page.title: 06INTERESTING PEOPLE
page.content: ...cont. from p.5 Mr. Baker only keeps 75 Suffolks because of cost. He breeds 150 calves a year. He pays Â£10 for a call from the vet. Pigs eat the most food, about 4lbs a day each. He milks the cows twice a day. He has no garden and it is a mixed farm. There are no proper hours for a farmer. There are 5 rams and 2 bulls. The biggest animal is the Charolais, a bull of which can cost up to Â£6000, but the average cow sells for Â£450 and the animals produce around 91000 gallons of milk a year. There are 40-50 eggs a day.
